tournament.name: Monday 1st Qualifier for MagicFest Online Season 2

decks.notes: The deck aims to control the game through counter spells, removal, and card advantage while utilizing companions to add an additional layer of synergy. By using a mix of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils, along with board wipes like Shatter the Sky and Deafening Clarion, the deck can maintain control of the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Shark Typhoon provides a win condition in the form of large flying tokens, ensuring the deck can close out the game once it has established control.

The primary strategy of this deck is to quickly pressure the opponent with low-cost aggressive creatures while utilizing sacrificing and graveyard mechanics to generate additional value and disrupt the opponent's board state. The deck aims to maintain a fast tempo and constantly apply pressure to the opponent's life total while also gaining incremental advantages through sacrificing creatures for various effects. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion further enhances the deck's ability to recur creatures from the graveyard and maintain a strong board presence throughout the game.

The key strategy of this deck is to focus on utilizing sacrifice effects and recursion to aggressively control the board and drain the opponent's life total. With cards like Witch's Oven and Cauldron Familiar for consistent pings of damage, alongside Claim the Firstborn for stealing key creatures, the deck aims to build incremental advantage while pressuring the opponent's life total with aggressive creatures like Dreadhorde Butcher and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger. The overall goal is to maintain a steady stream of threats and disruption to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on using powerful and versatile spells to control the board and outvalue opponents. With a mix of counterspells, removal, and card draw, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ramping into powerful threats like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Hydroid Krasis. The inclusion of cards like Casualties of War and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provide additional value and flexibility in dealing with a variety of threats. Overall, the deck aims to grind out incremental advantages and eventually overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats and resource advantage.

This deck aims to control the game by utilizing the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast multiple spells without spending any mana. It focuses on removal and board wipes to keep the opponent's threats in check while applying pressure with powerful Planeswalkers like Teferi, Narset, and Chandra. The deck also includes card draw and utility spells to maintain card advantage and find answers when needed. The goal is to outvalue the opponent and take control of the game until a win condition can be achieved through powerful spells like Inspired Ultimatum or the alternate win condition provided by Fae of Wishes.

The deck aims to control the game by using Fires of Invention to cast spells for free and limit the opponent's options. It includes a variety of powerful creatures and spells to keep the board in check and maintain card advantage. The combination of control elements and high-impact threats allows the deck to outvalue opponents and close out the game efficiently. The inclusion of Keruga as a companion adds additional card draw and consistency to the strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to use Gyruda, Doom of Depths as a companion to consistently cheat out powerful creatures from the top of the deck. By utilizing cards that can manipulate the library such as Thassa's Oracle and Shark Typhoon, along with creatures like Spark Double and Thassa, Deep-Dwelling, the deck aims to quickly generate value and overwhelm the opponent with a flood of threats. The inclusion of ramp spells like Growth Spiral and Wolfwillow Haven helps to accelerate the deck's game plan and allow for explosive plays.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, board wipes, and powerful planeswalkers. It also utilizes a variety of multicolored cards to take advantage of Niv-Mizzet Reborn's ability to draw additional cards. With cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Thought Erasure, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion allows for an additional source of mana ramp. Overall, the deck aims to control the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice effects and recurring creatures from the graveyard to deal consistent damage to the opponent. By combining cards like Cauldron Familiar, Witch's Oven, and Priest of Forgotten Gods, the deck can generate value and drain the opponent's life total quickly. Additionally, Fiend Artisan provides both a threat and a way to tutor for key creatures. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature recursion and life drain effects to secure a victory in the early to mid game.

This deck focuses on an aggressive playstyle with a Rakdos color combination, utilizing cards that can quickly deal damage to the opponent and keep up pressure. The deck includes cards like Claim the Firstborn, Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, Dreadhorde Butcher, and Cauldron Familiar to control the board and deal damage efficiently. The deck also includes cards like Lurrus of the Dream-Den and Whisper Squad to maintain a steady flow of threats. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells.

The focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence and apply constant pressure on the opponent by utilizing sacrifice effects and recurring threats. By using cards like Claim the Firstborn, Witch's Oven, and Priest of Forgotten Gods, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value through sacrificing creatures. With the ability to bring back creatures from the graveyard with Call of the Death-Dweller and Lurrus of the Dream-Den, the deck can maintain a steady flow of threats to overwhelm the opponent and achieve victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing card advantage and tempo control through cards like Growth Spiral, Uro, and Wilderness Reclamation. It also includes removal spells like Scorching Dragonfire and Storm's Wrath to handle threats, while countering opponent's spells with Mystical Dispute and Essence Scatter. The deck has versatile game finishers with Expansion / Explosion and Shark Typhoon, along with flexibility in card selection with Thassa's Intervention and Opt. The mana base includes various dual lands to ensure consistent access to all colors of mana for spells of different colors.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures to control the opponent's board and slow down their game plan. By utilizing cards like Narset, Parter of Veils to limit card draw, Ashiok, Nightmare Muse to create threats, and Shark Typhoon for token generation, this deck aims to dominate the battlefield and outvalue the opponent. With a focus on disruption and control, this deck seeks to outlast the opponent and secure a victory through attrition.
